availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William George Scott (Ballard county, KY, farmer)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Susan Hinkle Scott in Shelby County, Kentucky, on January 13, 1848. Father of Charles Scott, Georgiana Scott, William C. Scott, Henry C. Scott, and Laura E. Scott. Owned two enslaved persons in Ballard County in 1860. Farmer in Ballard County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Lovelaceville District, p. 159.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Lovelaceville District, p. 20.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Lovelaceville District, p. 21.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Shelby County Marriages, Film #000259274, p. 1669.
Find A Grave, "William George Scott (1819-1902)," Memorial #35956375, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/35956375 (accessed May 10, 2018).
